intro: Impatiens saxicola, commonly known as the rock impatiens, is a flowering plant native to arid and rocky regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, spurred flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its stems are often hairy. Impatiens saxicola is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions.
